title: In an examination, A has scored 20 marks more than B. If B has scored 5% less marks than A, how much has B scored? - Quora

response.answer_text: Marks scored by A = 20 + B ——(i) Marks scored by B = (100 - 5)% of A.= 95% of A or marks scored by B = 0.95A ——(ii) Substituting 0.95 A for B in (i), we get Marks scored by A = 20+ 0.95A or A - 0.95A = 20 or 0.05 A = 20 or A = 400 Substituting the value of A in (i), we get 400 = 20 + B or B = 400–20 or B = 380 Thus the marks scored by B are 380 This question can be solved in another way also as under : - B has scored 20 marks less than A which is 5% less than what A has scored. This means that B has scored 95% of what A has scored. Also it means that 20 marks is 5% of what A has scored. So, now 5% marks means = 20 marks or 1% marks means = 20/5 marks = 4 marks Thus 95% marks mean = 4 x 95 marks = 380 marks Thus the marks scored by B are 380 Ans

A score = 100 Marks and the question say B score 5% less mark than A which means if A score 100 marks B score will be 95 marks. Difference between 100–95 = 5 but the question say difference between A marks and B marks is 20, so 20÷5= 4. 1 unit = 4 then actual score of A is 4×100=400, B actual score = 4×95= 380 ans.
